Class Car

java.lang.Object
  Car

public class Car
extends Object

The Car class models a graphics object on the display it must store:

  • an enum definition integer to manage direction: up, down, left, right
  • whether this Car is selected (or not)
  • a RoundRectangle to display the Car in the window
  • Car dimensions and movement increment
  • a reference back to the A3ButtonWindow

Version:
2010
Author:
CSC 142

Constructor Detail

Car

public Car(int upperLeftX,
           int upperLeftY,
           Color newColor,
           boolean newSelect,
           aLibrary.A3ButtonWindow newWin,
           Court c)
Constructor for objects of class Car
  • initializes all instance variables of Car class

  • instantiates the RoundRectangle graphics object

  • initializes the color of the graphics object

  • sets graphics object as Filled if this is the selected Car

  • places the graphics object in the window container

Parameters:
upperLeftX - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this Car
upperLeftY - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this Car
newColor - the desired color for this Car
newSelect - true if this Car is the selected Car, false otherwise
newWin - a reference variable to the A3ButtonWindow
Method Detail

advanceDirection

public void advanceDirection()
advances the stored direction of this Car in the following order: right, up, left, down

must go from down direction to right direction

also changes displayed text in mid button and

repaints the window

deSelect

public void deSelect()
sets this Car as NOT selected

also sets outline display and repaints the window

isSelected

public boolean isSelected()
Returns:
true if this is the selected Car, false otherwise

moveCar

public void moveCar()
moves the selected Car in the direction that is set within its direction variable

select

public void select()
sets this Car as the selected Car

also sets fill and updates the mid button text

repaints the window
